text:
For those that are running into the same problem. We found that metadata is not returned instead they are formatted as HubSpot properties. Engagement fields we found:
hs_timestamp, hs_createdate, hs_object_id, hs_engagement_type, hs_note_body, hs_body_preview, hs_body_preview_is_truncated

About *export_to_template_context=true*, are there any known issues lately?

I try to export from _blog_post_  to _blog_listing_ template. And have a working example in another theme, but now what ever I do, the _content.widget_ object is always empty. Any clue?
*Update:* I get it. If there is no custom change in the module, it is not exported. Only those modules that contain a changed field are exported.
We don’t store data at the page level for modules that haven’t had their fields updated. This is because that module is still inheriting it’s module level or template level default values.
